  1. Introduction

  2. Byte, Char, String

    1. byte: a byte
    2. char: encoded in the default charset utf-8
    3. String: encapsulate a char []

    1. string -> byte[]: [need encoding with a charset]. string.getBytes
    2. string -> char[]: string.toCharArray()
    3. byte[] -> string: string(byte [], charset) / [Arrays.toString(byte []), it returns a list of number, not text]
    4. byte[] -> char[]: no direct ways
    5. char[] -> string: string(char[]) / [Arrays.toString(cahr []), it returns a list of char, not text]
    6. char[] -> byte[]: no direct ways

    import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;

public class charset {
    public static void main(String [] args) throws UnsupportedEncodingException {
        byte [] q = new byte[]{0x00, 113, 0x00, 110};
        String s = new String(q, "UTF-16"); // UTF-16BE decoding
        q = s.getBytes(); // UTF-8 encoding
        System.out.println(q.length); // 2
    }
}
